title: Aoxi (Eric) Tu
text:
Academic Experience

  2024.10–2025.12
  
    
      Speech Perception and Production Lab
    , University of Chicago
  
  Research Assistant



  
  
    
      Contributed to postdoctoral research on language perception, including studies on the effects of exposure to non-native English vowel productions using eye-tracking paradigms.
      Gained mastery of the full research cycle, from experimental design and data collection to statistical analysis and result reporting.
      Used Praat software to preprocess and analyze experimental data stored in WAV files, including acoustic spectrogram reading, acoustic boundary labeling, and data curation, etc.
      Attended weekly lab meetings to provide critical feedback and advice to team members on ongoing research projects.
      Collaborated with team members via tools such as Slack, Trello, and Box, ensuring transparent workflows and consistent data management.
    

    Research Outcomes & Skills Gained:
    
      Developed expertise in acoustic analysis, linguistic experimental design, and team-based research workflows.
      Strengthened competence in statistical and computational methods (Python, R) applied to linguistic data analysis.
      Strengthened research writing skills and multimodal academic expression.
      Enhanced interdisciplinary collaboration and project communication skills.
      Lay a solid foundation for future research in language modeling, cognitive neurolinguistics, and natural language processing at the master's level.
